item.title: Always filthy here, 5th August
item.description:
Due to this space being used by drug related activities and drinking alcohol this spot is always filthy! Please assist

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Peckham Square, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Permanent litter across this entire road, 5th August
item.description:
I have moved to the area 9 months ago. I’m paying significant council tax yet that road has not been cleaned in months. I keep seeing the same rubbish every day - the shrubs are filthy. Both bus stops are full of rubbish and there are items floating around all across that road stretch. Can you please let me know what is the cleaning schedule? Why haven’t we seen any street cleaning in several months now? Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): South Eden Park Road, Eden Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Urgent Request to empty disabled/sick person’s bin, 5th August
item.description:
Dear Bin Team, I am an Environment Champion living on Waverley Road. I would be grateful if the bin team emptied the bins for a disabled/sick resident living in 26 Auburn House on Waverley Road. The bins are overflowing with flies all over. It is apparent that the resident is not able to put her bins on the curb during bin collection due to disability hence the overflowing bins which spills onto the street. I regularly pick litter on Waverley Road as a volunteer and wind is constantly blowing rubbish from the overflowing bins onto the road. I will be grateful if the bin team takes the woman’s disability into consideration and empty the bins. I also noticed that the recycling bin is filled with rubbish, this too should be emptied by the black bin team. Thank you in advance for your understanding on this matter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Waverley Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
